intro: Matelea ochracea, commonly known as the yellow matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically ovate with a slightly hairy surface, and the stems are often hairy as well. Matelea ochracea thrives in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
